channel.title: Reflection
channel.description:
This isn't about Java Reflection, but about actual reflection of light.
So today I was minding my own business while on a bus. Dutch buses, like most buses, have front and mid-way doors. The mid-way door has a glass pane perpendicular to it. Because of height differences in the bus (the floor in the back is higher than in the front), the glass pane reflects. So I was sitting behind someone, and as I said minding my own business. But every time I looked at that glass pane, I could see right into the eyes of the person in front of me. It seemed as if this person was looking at me, and when I looked at it we were looking in each others eyes.
So that got me wondering: If I recall correctly, then reflection works both ways. If I were sitting in both seats at the same time, I would be looking into my own eyes. Am I right, or was this person looking at something completely different?
Look at image below what I mean, use of wrong terms might be confusing.
